page.title: 03High School,Wick
page.content: Wick High School,which has 930 pupils, was opened on the 23rd August 1911 and is the only secondary school for the east side of Caithness.Children travel daily by bus from Berriedale,Watten and John O' Groats.There is a staff of seventy teachers and there are forty classes.The classes vary in size from 28 in the lower school,25 in the middle to 20 in the upper. Since it was opened they have had about 6 headmasters.Mr Macleod has been rector for 8 years. In 1960 a large extension,including a language laboratory,was built.The school has many clubs including computing,athletics,chess and rugby. In June 1985 primary and secondary pupils presented a most enjoyable and successful musical Noyes Fludde by Benjamin Britten.
